questions.question_text: Karoḍ kām bagāḍīne paṇ ek _____ sudhārvo ne kadāpi karoḍ kām sudhāryā ne ek mokṣha bagāḍyo to temā shu karyu?
questions.explanation: According to Swamini Vato 1/14, even after spoiling millions of tasks, one should improve one's moksha.

questions.question_text: Ā meḍiyu maḷī chhe ne sāru sāru khāvā maḷe chhe, ke mān maḷe chhe, ityādik manuṣhya dehnu faḷ nathī. Te to vimukhne paṇ maḷe chhe. Māṭe manuṣhya dehnu faḷ to sārāno sang ne swabhāv ṭaḷe, eṭalu ja chhe. Aa vākhya kyānu chhe?
questions.explanation: This quote is from Swamini Vato 2/19, discussing the true benefit of the human body.

questions.question_text: Āpaṇe paṇ e _____ je mukta temanī panktimā bhaḷavu chhe ane Akṣhardhāmmā jaīne akhanḍ Bhagwānnī sevāmā hajūr rahevu chhe, paṇ nāshavant ne tuchchh evu je māyik sukh tene ichchhavu nathī ne emā koī ṭhekāṇe lobhāvu nathī.
questions.explanation: Vachanamrut Gadhada Pratham 21 states that we want to join the ranks of Aksharrup muktas and remain in the service of God in Akshardham.

questions.question_text: Āpaṇo janma be vāt sādhavā sāru thayo chhe, temā ek _____ thāvu, emā deh antarāyrūp chhe; ne bīju Bhagwānmā joḍāvu, temā sang anek prakārnā antarāyrūp chhe. E be khoṭ ṭaḷavī.
questions.explanation: According to Swamini Vato 4/99, one aim of our birth is to become Aksharrup.

questions.question_text: Āpaṇo janma be vāt sādhavā sāru thayo chhe, temā ek Akṣharrūp thāvu, emā deh antarāyrūp chhe; ne bīju _____ joḍāvu, temā sang anek prakārnā antarāyrūp chhe. E be khoṭ ṭaḷavī.
questions.explanation: Swamini Vato 4/99 states that one aim is to become Aksharrup, and the other is to connect with Bhagwan.

questions.question_text: “...marī to sarvene javu chhe paṇ āvī rīte bhakti karavī e ja jīvyāno moṭo lābh chhe...” Aa vākhya kyānu chhe?
questions.explanation: This quote is from Vachanamrut Gadhada Antya 30, emphasizing the benefit of living through devotion.

questions.question_text: Nāshvant ā deh vadhethi, avinashi fal _____ ji, patrāvaane jemi karine, bahaar feki devu ji
questions.explanation: From the Kirtan of Narayandas Swami, 'Nāshvant ā deh vadhethi, avinashi fal levu ji'.
